intro: Trigonotis corispermoides var. sessilis, commonly known as the sessile trigonotis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its distinctive triangular-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, violet-colored flowers that bloom in clusters, adding ornamental value to its appearance. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
